## fix: Anime library routing

### Bug Fix
Anime was being routed to the Shows library instead of the Anime library.

### Root Cause
The initial `IsAnime()` check used minimal search metadata (which has `Type=Series` and no genres). After fetching full metadata, the genres and type info needed to re-determine routing.

### Fix
- After `GetMetaAsync` returns full metadata, `IsAnime()` is re-evaluated with the complete meta (including genres like "Anime")
- If the re-check returns true, the root folder is updated to the Anime folder before inserting
- Logged as: `Re-routed {Name} to anime folder based on full metadata`

### Result
Anime content is now correctly routed to the configured AnimePath library.

## feat: Anime Library Support

- Separate anime library path (`AnimePath`) - add a dedicated Jellyfin library pointing to this path
- Auto-detection of anime via: `StremioMediaType.Anime`, anime ID prefixes (`anidb:`, `kitsu:`, `mal:`, `anilist:`), and `Anime` genre tag
- Routing in `InsertActionFilter`: anime items go to the anime folder (falls back to series folder if not configured)
- Catalog `IsAnime` flag: force all items from a catalog into the anime library (configurable per-catalog in the UI)
- Per-user `AnimePath` override in User Configs
- Correct folder passed through `SyncSeriesTreesAsync` so series tree is built in the right library

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Tonttis/Gelato/compare/v0.26.5.5...v0.26.5.6
- fix: populate AnimeFolder in GetConfig so anime routes to correct library

feat: anime library separation

- Added separate anime library path configuration
- Anime content is now handled independently from movies and shows
